products.name: Kingsford Match Light Instant Charcoal Briquets

extendedInfo.detail: About 2 uses. No lighter fluid needed. The first. The best. The original. In 1920, Kingsford sparked a backyard revolution by transforming scrap wood from the ford model t into the first charcoal briquets. Today, America's favorite charcoal still brings people together for delicious wood-fired BBQ. Since 1920. Lights instantly (When used as directed). An American Original: At Kingsford, we take pride in giving you the best BBQ flavor by using quality ingredients, including real American wood. We proudly craft our briquets in plants across the USA with generations of expertise. Bringing you the best in authentic BBQ flavor since 1920. Visit us at kingsford.com. Questions or Comments? Visit us on the web at kingsford.com or call 1-800-232-4745. For more information on the guarantee. visit kingsford.com/guarantee.  how2recycle.info.
extendedInfo.directions: (1) Stack briquets in a pyramid. Do not overfill your grill. Use about 4 lb. Light immediately. (2) Light charcoal. Leave grill uncovered. Do not use lighter fluid or an electric or chimney-style starter. Stand back after lighting. Flames will die out. (3) Spread briquets in a single layer when covered in ash (in about 10 minutes). Begin grilling. Always create a tight seal to close bag after each use.  Store in a cool, dry place.
extendedInfo.warnings: This product can expose you to chemicals, including soot, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer, and carbon monoxide, which is known to the State of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm. For more information, go to www.P65Warnings.ca.gov.Caution: Combustible. Read side panel carefully.Caution: Combustible. Keep away from heat and open flames. Contains petroleum distillates. Store in well-ventilated area. Keep bag closed to avoid evaporation. Keep out of reach of children & pets.Carbon Monoxide Hazard: Burning charcoal inside can kill you. It gives off carbon monoxide, which has no odor. Never burn charcoal inside homes, vehicles or tents. For your Safety: Never cover flaming briquets with a grill lid. Covering flaming briquets may result in a flare-up when lid is removed. Use water to control excessive flames. Do not light any part of the bag. Barbecue away from flammable items, overhangs and trees. Do not add match light charcoal once fire has been lit. Add Kingsford original charcoal briquets if extra charcoal is needed. Make sure ashes are cold before discarding. Do not use in water smoker grills.
extendedInfo.countryOfOrigin: Made In The USA With North American Ingredients. Proudly Manufactured In The USA. Made In USA Of Global Ingredients.,USA
